entry.title: Hammerspoon Scripting
entry.content:
Hammerspoon Utilities Documentation

Introduction

This repository provides a set of utility functions built for the Hammerspoon macOS automation toolã€‚These functions allow you to manage your clipboard historyï¼Œcontrol the positions of your mouse across applicationsï¼Œand execute custom shell commands via keybindingsã€‚With this toolsetï¼Œyou can enhance your productivity and make your macOS experience smoother and more streamlinedã€‚

Table of Contents

  1. Prerequisites
  2. Installation
  3. Usage
    • Clipboard Manager
    • Mouse Position Control
    • Shell Commands Execution
  4. Contributing
  5. License
  6. FAQs
  7. Troubleshooting
  8. Known Issues

Prerequisites

  • macOSï¼šThe scripts are tailored for macOSï¼Œleveraging the capabilities of Hammerspoonã€‚

  • Hammerspoonï¼šEnsure that you have Hammerspoon installedã€‚Itâ€™s a bridge between the operating system and a Lua scripting engineã€‚

Installation

  1. Clone this Repositoryï¼š

  2. Navigate to Hammerspoon Configuration Folderï¼š

  3. Copy the Scriptï¼šMove the cloned Lua script to the Hammerspoon configuration directory or incorporate its functionalities into your existing init.luaã€‚

  4. Reload Hammerspoonï¼šUse the Hammerspoon menu icon to reload the configuration or press the default cmd + ctrl + shift + reload key combinationã€‚

Usage

Clipboard Manager

Keybindingsï¼š

  • Combine Clipboard Historiesï¼šcmd + alt + C
  • Clear Clipboard Historyï¼šcmd + alt + ctrl + C

Mouse Position Control

Recordï¼Œrecallï¼Œand manipulate mouse positions across different appsã€‚

Keybindingsï¼š

  • Record mouse position for the active appï¼šcmd + ctrl + shift + R
  • Clear recorded positions for the active appï¼šcmd + ctrl + shift + C
  • Move mouse to a specified position (1ï¼Œ2ï¼Œor 3) for the active appï¼šcmd + ctrl + shift + [1/2/3]
  • Move mouse to next/previous recorded positionï¼šalt + tab / alt + shift + tab

Shell Commands Execution

Trigger specific shell commands via keybindingsã€‚

Keybindingsï¼š

(Replace shellScripts.[command] with actual commands or scripts youâ€™ve definedã€‚)

  • Toggle Yabaiï¼šcmd + shift + y
  • Close Windowï¼šcmd + shift + w
  • Toggle Floating Tilingï¼šcmd + shift + l
  • Swap with Next or Move to Firstï¼šcmd + shift + j
  • Toggle Fullscreenï¼šcmd + ctrl + f
  • Focus on Next or Move to Firstï¼šcmd + j

Contributing

Contributions are welcomeï¼If you find a bug or would like to add a new featureï¼Œfeel free to create an issue or open a pull requestã€‚

License

This project is licensed under the MIT Licenseã€‚For more detailsï¼Œsee the LICENSE fileã€‚

FAQs

  • Qï¼šIâ€™m new to Hammerspoonã€‚How can I get startedï¼Ÿ

    Aï¼šCheck out the official Hammerspoon documentation for a comprehensive introductionã€‚

Troubleshooting

  • **Script not executingï¼Ÿ**Ensure that Hammerspoon has the necessary accessibility permissions under System Preferences > Security & Privacy > Privacyã€‚

Known Issues

  • Moving the mouse to recorded positions may not work seamlessly across multiple monitors or virtual desktopsã€‚Ensure that the app is on the same screen as the original recordingã€‚

For more detailsï¼Œquestionsï¼Œor feedbackï¼Œplease raise an issue or get in touchã€‚Happy codingï¼ğŸš€

introduce
zmodule environmentï¼šThis plugin provides a set of environment variables that can be used to customize your shell environmentã€‚
zmodule gitï¼šThis plugin provides a set of aliases and functions that can be used to interact with the Git version control systemã€‚
zmodule inputï¼šThis plugin provides a set of functions that can be used to interact with the terminal inputã€‚
zmodule termtitleï¼šThis plugin provides a set of functions that can be used to set the terminal titleã€‚
zmodule utilityï¼šThis plugin provides a set of utility functions that can be used to simplify shell scriptingã€‚
zmodule duration-infoï¼šThis plugin provides a set of functions that can be used to display the duration of commandsã€‚
zmodule git-infoï¼šThis plugin provides a set of functions that can be used to display information about Git repositoriesã€‚
zmodule asciishipï¼šThis plugin provides a set of functions that can be used to play the classic game of Battleship in the terminalã€‚
zmodule zsh-users/zsh-completions --fpath srcï¼šThis plugin provides additional completions for Zshã€‚
zmodule completionï¼šThis plugin provides a set of functions that can be used to generate completions for custom commandsã€‚
zmodule zsh-users/zsh-syntax-highlightingï¼šThis plugin provides syntax highlighting for Zshã€‚
zmodule zsh-users/zsh-history-substring-searchï¼šThis plugin provides substring search for Zsh historyã€‚
zmodule zsh-users/zsh-autosuggestionsï¼šThis plugin provides autosuggestions for Zshã€‚
zmodule jeffreytse/zsh-vi-modeï¼šThis plugin provides Vi mode for Zshã€‚

zmodule hlissner/zsh-autopairï¼šhttps://github.com/hlissner/zsh-autopair
zmodule pabloariasal/zfmï¼šhttps://github.com/pabloariasal/zfm
zmodule agkozak/zsh-zï¼šhttps://github.com/agkozak/zsh-z
zmodule Aloxaf/fzf-tabï¼šhttps://github.com/Aloxaf/fzf-tab
Hereâ€™s a brief description of each pluginï¼š

zmodule prompt-pwdï¼šThis plugin provides a way to display the current working directory in your shell promptã€‚
zmodule magicmaceï¼šThis plugin provides a prompt theme inspired by the Xero accounting softwareã€‚
zmodule supercrabtree/kï¼šThis plugin provides a way to navigate your shell history more easilyã€‚
zmodule hlissner/zsh-autopairï¼šThis plugin provides a way to automatically close and delete bracketsï¼Œquotesï¼Œand other paired charactersã€‚
zmodule pabloariasal/zfmï¼šThis plugin provides a way to bookmark files and directories in your system and rapidly access themã€‚
zmodule agkozak/zsh-zï¼šThis plugin provides a way to jump quickly to directories that you have visited beforeã€‚
zmodule Aloxaf/fzf-tabï¼šThis plugin replaces Zshâ€™s default completion system with fzfï¼Œa fuzzy finder that allows you to quickly search for files and directoriesã€‚

CSV æ•°æ®å¤„ç†ä¸ Word/Excel ä¸­çš„è¡¨æ ¼æ ¼å¼è°ƒæ•´æ•™ç¨‹ ğŸ“–

è¿™ä¸ªå‡½æ•°çš„å‰ææ˜¯ä½ å·²ç»æŒ‰ç…§ä¹‹å‰æè¿°çš„çº¦å®šå‘½åäº†ä½ çš„æ–‡ä»¶ã€‚å®ƒå°†ä¸ºæ¯ä¸ªæ¨¡å‹å’Œæ¡ˆä¾‹åˆ›å»ºä¸€ä¸ªæ–°çš„åˆ—ï¼Œå¹¶åœ¨ç»“æœ CSV æ–‡ä»¶ä¸­å°†æ‰€æœ‰è¿™äº›åˆ—åˆå¹¶åœ¨ä¸€èµ·ã€‚

entry.title: PyQt vs Tkinter
entry.content:
PyQt and Tkinter are two popular libraries in Python for building graphical user interfaces (GUIs)ã€‚Hereâ€™s a comparison of their featuresï¼Œadvantagesï¼Œand disadvantages to help you choose between themï¼š

Origin & Backgroundï¼š

Tkinterï¼šTkinter is the standard GUI library for Python and has been around for a very long timeã€‚It provides a simple way to create windowsï¼Œdialogsï¼Œbuttonsï¼Œand other GUI elementsã€‚Itâ€™s based on the Tk GUI toolkitã€‚
PyQtï¼šPyQt is a set of Python bindings for the Qt librariesã€‚Qt is a free and open-source widget toolkit for creating graphical user interfacesã€‚
Learning Curveï¼š

Tkinterï¼šGenerally considered easier for beginners due to its simplicity and being included with most Python installationsã€‚
PyQtï¼šHas a steeper learning curve than Tkinterï¼Œbut it offers more widgets and advanced functionalitiesã€‚
Look and Feelï¼š

Tkinterï¼šHas a more basic look and might not feel as modern or native on all platformsã€‚Howeverï¼Œwith some effortï¼Œdecent-looking interfaces can be builtã€‚
PyQtï¼šProvides a more modern and native look on different platforms due to the power of the underlying Qt frameworkã€‚
Featuresï¼š

Tkinterï¼šProvides basic widgets and functionalities for GUI developmentã€‚Suitable for simple applicationsã€‚
PyQtï¼šOffers a wider variety of widgetsï¼Œas well as advanced features such as 2D and 3D graphicsï¼Œnetworking supportï¼Œand moreã€‚
Extensibilityï¼š

Tkinterï¼šMore limited in terms of features and extensibilityã€‚
PyQtï¼šHas a richer set of modules and can be extended further using other parts of the Qt frameworkã€‚
Licensingï¼š

Tkinterï¼šItâ€™s open-source and free to use for any purposeã€‚
PyQtï¼šCommercial and GPL-licensed versions are availableã€‚For proprietary applicationsï¼Œa commercial license is neededï¼Œwhich can be costlyã€‚An alternative is PySideï¼Œwhich provides the same functionality as PyQt but under a more permissive LGPL licenseã€‚
Performanceï¼š

Tkinterï¼šAdequate for simple applications but might be limited for more complexï¼Œresource-intensive GUIsã€‚
PyQtï¼šGenerally offers better performance and responsivenessï¼Œespecially for more complex applicationsã€‚
Community & Supportï¼š

Tkinterï¼šHas been around for a long timeï¼Œso there are plenty of resources availableï¼Œbut it might not be as active as newer frameworksã€‚
PyQtï¼šHas a strong communityï¼Œwith a lot of resourcesï¼Œtutorialsï¼Œand support due to the popularity of the Qt framework itselfã€‚
Conclusionï¼š

If you are just starting with GUI development or need to whip up a quick and simple interface for a script or small applicationï¼ŒTkinter might be the better choiceã€‚

If youâ€™re building a more complexï¼Œfeature-rich application or want a modern look and feelï¼ŒPyQt (or PySide) would likely be a better fitã€‚

entry.title: Monitor Control
entry.content:
Monitor Control Settingsï¼š

  1. Smooth Brightness Transitionsï¼šOpt for seamless adjustments or get straight-to-the-point controlã€‚
  2. Extended Dimmingï¼šCombine hardware and software for that perfect dimï¼Œespecially when your hardwareâ€™s given its allã€‚
  3. Sync Your Shineï¼šAny brightness tweaksï¼Œwhether from Ambient light sensors or Control Centerï¼Œget mirrored across all displaysã€‚Keep things harmoniousï¼
  4. Zero Brightnessï¼Ÿï¼šDive into complete darknessï¼Œbut bewareï¼Combine this with no keyboard controlsï¼Œand you might be lost for a bitã€‚

Navigate wisely and illuminate splendidlyï¼ğŸ–¥âœ¨

entry.title: Windows Upgrade Guide
entry.content:
Windows Home to Pro: Step-by-Step Upgrade Guide ğŸš€

  1. Go Offline: Disconnect from the internet.
  2. Start the Upgrade: Head to Settings > System > About, then choose â€œChange Product Keyâ€ or â€œUpgradeâ€.
  3. Use the Special Key: Enter the generic Windows 10 Pro key (this wonâ€™t activate, but itâ€™s legit for the upgrade):
    • VK7JG-NPHTM-C97JM-9MPGT-3V66T
  4. Begin the Magic: Hit start and watch your Windows elevate to Pro.
  5. Activate with Flair: After the upgrade, revisit the product key section. Now, run the following commands:
    • slmgr /ipk W269N-WFGWX-YVC9B-4J6C9-T83GX
    • slmgr /skms kms.loli.best
    • slmgr /ato
  6. Reconnect and Revel: Jump back online, and let Windows do its activation dance!

Upgrade completed with style! ğŸŒŸ Enjoy the Pro life!
